com.grzm.pqconninfo.alpha

Class Passfile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.grzm.pqconninfo.alpha.Passfile

  • public final class Passfile
extends Object
    Functions for finding a password in a given passfile input stream.

    • Method Detail

      • parsePgpassLine

        public static String parsePgpassLine(String host,
                                     String port,
                                     String dbname,
                                     String user,
                                     String line)
        Parses the given passfile line, returning the password value if it matches (taking into account wildcards) the given host, port, dbname, and user values.

        Returns null if the line is malformed or doesn't match the given values.

        Parameters:
        host - host to match
        port - port to match
        dbname - dbname to match
        user - user to match
        line - line to parse and match
        Returns:
        password if matched and null otherwise

      • getPassword

        public static String getPassword(Map<PqConninfoOption,String> conninfo,
                                 InputStream pgpass)
        Searches the given passfile input stream for a password that matches the options in the given conninfo.
        Parameters:
        conninfo - The conninfo to find a password for
        pgpass - The inputstream for the passfile contents
        Returns:
        the password found in the input stream, or null if none found

      • getPassword

        public static String getPassword(String hostOption,
                                 String portOption,
                                 String dbname,
                                 String user,
                                 InputStream pgpass)
        Searches the given passfile input tream for a password that matches the given options This corresponds roughly to passwordFromFile in fe-connect.c static char * passwordFromFile(const char *hostname, const char *port, const char *dbname, const char *username, const char *pgpassfile) This java implementation takes an InputStream instead of a file name for abstraction. This makes testing easier by separating IO from application logic. It also separates the concerns of determining which file to use, or whether a file is available at all. The PostgreSQL documentation mentions obliquely that lines beginning with a "#" are ignored. AFAICT, there isn't explicit code to handle this. It falls out of the fact that host names can't begin with a "#", and therefore we won't match any pgpassfile entry that is prefixed with a "#".
        Parameters:
        hostOption - the host value to match
        portOption - the port value to match
        dbname - the dbname value to match
        user - the user value to match
        pgpass - the passfile input stream to search
        Returns:
        the password value if found, and null otherwise
